title: Definitions
context: PART II. STATE BUILDING CODE AND DESIGN STANDARDS ยง107-21 Definitions. As used in this part: &ldquo;Codes and standards&rdquo; means nationally recognized minimum requirements that shall be met for design and construction to safeguard life, property, and the general welfare. &ldquo;Council&rdquo; means the state building code council. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of accounting and general services. &ldquo;Hawaii state building codes&rdquo; means the building codes and standards that the state building code council adopts under section 107-24. &ldquo;Hurricane resistant criteria&rdquo; means the design criteria for enhanced hurricane protection areas that are capable of withstanding a five hundred-year hurricane event, as developed by the state department of defense for public shelter and residential safe room design criteria. &ldquo;State building construction&rdquo; means any building construction project or program initiated by a state agency or requiring the use of state funds. [L 2007, c 82, pt of ยง2; am L 2014, c 164, ยง2]
